etymology.description: semantic 㕯 ("to speak slowly") + phonetic 章 ("zhāng") -> originally meant estimating from the outside -> developed to mean trading/commerce
etymology.interpretation: The character 商(shāng) originally described the concept of estimating, which is linked to trading where one evaluates items before purchasing or exchanging them. Over time, the meaning shifted to specifically denote commerce or trade. The semantic component 㕯 relates to the idea of communication or deliberation, which is fundamental in trading contexts.

examples.chinese: 我对商机充满兴趣(我對商機充滿興趣)。
examples.english: I am very interested in business opportunities.

examples.chinese: 他进入商界谋求发展(他進入商界謀求發展)。
examples.english: He entered the business world to seek development.

examples.chinese: 商人讲求信誉(商人講求信譽)，消费者追求质量(消費者追求質量)。
examples.pinyin: Shāngrén jiǎngqiú xìn yù, xiāofèizhě zhuīqiú zhìliàng.
examples.english: Businesspeople value reputation, and consumers pursue quality.
